meanings.definition: Software that is embedded in hardware devices, such as computer chips or printers.
meanings.sent1: The firmware in my smartwatch controls its functions.
meanings.sent2: Updating the firmware on your router can improve its performance.
meanings.sent3: The firmware in the coffee machine decided to brew extra strong coffee today.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like firmware, unchangeable and steadfast.
meanings.sent5: The firmware of the robot was so advanced, it could anticipate human actions.

meanings.definition: The permanent software programmed into a read-only memory.
meanings.sent1: Make sure to back up your important data before updating the firmware.
meanings.sent2: The firmware of the DVD player cannot be altered by the user.
meanings.sent3: The firmware in the old game console still remembers all the high scores.
meanings.sent4: His loyalty was like firmware, unwavering and reliable.
meanings.sent5: The firmware of the spacecraft guided it safely through the asteroid field.
